p: Today I have something to say that we've been wishing, praying, and working for for two months now. Yes, the re-entry permits for George and his Grandmother have arrived. Thanking the Great Spirit is all I can feel is right, for we are certainly fortunate and happy about it. We do not know just when we'll leave for Mexico: this coming Tuesday at the earliest. It is necessary to have all our baggage checked through and our passport photos taken, as well as passports arranged,

and all this takes several days. Once in Mexico we must get acclimatized and must wait a few days till our agent there lines up our dates for us again. You can write me here again, just in case we're not gone yet, and if we are, letter will be returned or forwarded.
I have a few dollars now, so as to be safe in Mexico till we begin earning again.

There is not lots more to say now about us, except that we have been rehearsing and practicing and performing some too, which is all very much to the Good! Perhaps we shall dance again tomorrow night at the Victory Club. That is, if the orchestra can be gotten.

If you don't say anything about how you're feeling Daddy, but Mama tells me you've been very ill - better now, however. How does the osteopathy help you? Oh, Daddy, do be careful, won't you. I certainly hope this letter finds you felling much better.

Your new home sounds truly lovely. It must be fine to be in your home again. So Nebraska doesn't look as likely as Kansas City? The latter would be grand, and of course Richard's Mother would be thrilled to have you in her home. It would be very lovely
all around, I should think, for as long as you wanted it so. I hope it will not be long till I can aid you a bit.
Heard from Hilda today - such a happy, "up", strong letter that I was thrilled to get it. I shall write her our news too.
Pray for us as I do always for you - inside and out. And know how very very much I love and admire and cherish you.
I finished three Friends yesterday - How much I got out of it this time God! What Beauty and Truth and Greatness
